an9.51:1.1: “Reverend, they speak of ‘extinguishment in the present life’.
an9.51:1.2: In what way did the Buddha speak of extinguishment in the present life?”
an9.51:2.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures … enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.51:2.2: To this extent the Buddha spoke of extinguishment in the present life in a qualified sense. …
an9.51:3.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.51:3.2: To this extent the Buddha spoke of extinguishment in the present life in a definitive sense.”
